docs.abstract: The death of Judge Stephen Reinhardt, combined with other vacancies, gives President Trump a chance to remake a court that has bedeviled him.
docs.snippet: The death of Judge Stephen Reinhardt, combined with other vacancies, gives President Trump a chance to remake a court that has bedeviled him.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In the spring of 2014, a friend tried to nudge Judge Stephen Reinhardt, then an 83-year-old liberal stalwart on the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, into stepping aside from full-time duties so President Barack Obama could nominate a successor.

headline.main: Judge’s Death Gives Trump a Chance to Remake a Vexing Court
headline.print_headline: Judge’s Death Gives Trump a Chance to Remake a Vexing Court

docs.abstract: Mick Mulvaney has picked Kathy Kraninger, who oversees the preparation of budgets for several cabinet offices, two people familiar with the situation said.
docs.snippet: Mick Mulvaney has picked Kathy Kraninger, who oversees the preparation of budgets for several cabinet offices, two people familiar with the situation said.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mick Mulvaney, the White House budget director and acting head of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, has picked a deputy at the budget office, Kathy Kraninger, to succeed him at the consumer watchdog agency, according to two people familiar with the situation.

headline.main: Mulvaney Is Said to Want Deputy to Succeed Him at C.F.P.B.

docs.abstract: The president has remained in touch with Mr. Porter, the former White House staff secretary, since his resignation, according to people familiar with the conversations.
docs.snippet: The president has remained in touch with Mr. Porter, the former White House staff secretary, since his resignation, according to people familiar with the conversations.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump has stayed in touch with Rob Porter, the former White House staff secretary who stepped down after allegations that he had abused his two former wives came to light, according to three people familiar with the conversations, and has told some advisers he hopes Mr. Porter returns to work in the West Wing.

headline.main: Trump Talks of Bringing Back Rob Porter, Aide Accused of Spousal Abuse
headline.print_headline: Trump Pines for an Aide Who Resigned

docs.abstract: Anyone looking for a pattern should focus squarely on the man behind the desk in the Oval Office. “I like conflict,” President Trump said.
docs.snippet: Anyone looking for a pattern should focus squarely on the man behind the desk in the Oval Office. “I like conflict,” President Trump said.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN DIEGO — President Trump explained on Tuesday that he fired Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson because they do not see eye to eye on certain major issues. Then he confirmed that he may hire Larry Kudlow as his economics adviser even though they do not see eye to eye on certain major issues.

headline.main: As White House’s Revolving Door Whirls, Chaos Is the Only Constant

docs.abstract: Ms. McFarland’s nomination had become embroiled in the controversy over the Trump campaign’s contacts with Russian officials.
docs.snippet: Ms. McFarland’s nomination had become embroiled in the controversy over the Trump campaign’s contacts with Russian officials.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — K. T. McFarland, who was a deputy national security adviser in the Trump administration and then was picked to serve as ambassador to Singapore, withdrew her ambassadorial nomination on Friday after it had stalled in the Senate.

headline.main: K. T. McFarland Withdraws Her Nomination to Be Ambassador to Singapore

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

docs.abstract: Ms. Haspel, the deputy director of the C.I.A., ran a secret prison in Thailand in 2002 where a Qaeda suspect was waterboarded.
docs.snippet: Ms. Haspel, the deputy director of the C.I.A., ran a secret prison in Thailand in 2002 where a Qaeda suspect was waterboarded.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Just over a year after the Sept. 11 attacks, the C.I.A. dispatched the veteran clandestine officer Gina Haspel to oversee a secret prison in Thailand. Shortly after, agency contractors in the frantic hunt for the conspirators waterboarded a Qaeda suspect three times and subjected him to brutal interrogation techniques.

headline.main: Gina Haspel, Trump’s Choice for C.I.A., Played Role in Torture Program
headline.print_headline: Pick for C.I.A. Chief Ran Secret Prison

docs.abstract: Gina Haspel offered to withdraw her nomination to run the C.I.A. if her past role in the brutal interrogation of an Al Qaeda suspect threatened to tarnish the agency.
docs.snippet: Gina Haspel offered to withdraw her nomination to run the C.I.A. if her past role in the brutal interrogation of an Al Qaeda suspect threatened to tarnish the agency.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s pick to run the C.I.A., Gina Haspel, told White House officials last week that she would withdraw her nomination if they were concerned her role in the brutal interrogation of a Qaeda suspect would scuttle her confirmation and draw the intelligence agency into a fresh controversy over a program it disavowed years ago, according to administration officials and others familiar with the discussions.

headline.main: Gina Haspel Offered to Withdraw C.I.A. Nomination Amid Concerns Over Role in Torture Program
headline.print_headline: Nominee to Lead C.I.A. Offered to Withdraw

byline.original: By Matthew Rosenberg and Mark Landler

docs.abstract: The withdrawal of the nominee, Robert Weaver, follows reports that said he had inaccurately represented his qualifications to a Senate committee after his nomination in October.
docs.snippet: The withdrawal of the nominee, Robert Weaver, follows reports that said he had inaccurately represented his qualifications to a Senate committee after his nomination in October.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s nominee to lead the Indian Health Service has withdrawn his name from consideration for the position, a spokeswoman for the Department of Health and Humans Services said Wednesday.

headline.main: Trump’s Pick to Lead Indian Health Service Withdraws Nomination

docs.abstract: There is nothing new about ambassadors making unfortunate remarks, but an unusual number of top envoys in the Trump administration have provoked controversy among close allies and angered Democrats.
docs.snippet: There is nothing new about ambassadors making unfortunate remarks, but an unusual number of top envoys in the Trump administration have provoked controversy among close allies and angered Democrats.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump has made a trademark of upending many of the diplomatic traditions that have defined American foreign policy for decades, angering a host of longtime allies. Now, a growing number of his ambassadors are doing the same.

headline.main: A Growing List of U.S. Diplomats Acting Undiplomatically
headline.print_headline: List Grows of Diplomats  Acting Undiplomatically

docs.abstract: Jon Lerner, a veteran Republican pollster, will continue to work with Nikki R. Haley, the United Nations ambassador, even as he joins the vice president’s team.
docs.snippet: Jon Lerner, a veteran Republican pollster, will continue to work with Nikki R. Haley, the United Nations ambassador, even as he joins the vice president’s team.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Vice President Mike Pence has hired Jon Lerner, a veteran Republican pollster who is a deputy for the United Nations ambassador, Nikki R. Haley, as his national security adviser, a spokeswoman for Mr. Pence said on Thursday evening.

headline.main: Pence Hires Haley Aide as National Security Adviser, Creating Unusual Dual Role
